column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4921_44eb246069593a4d89b53b349a632e7edea11b01/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te

> makes searching the logs easier

You could search for peer=1[^0-9] instead of peer=1.

> Reset NodeId to START_NODEID when all connections lost

I'd - personally - prefer to maximize the time between reuse of node ids. Is there any concrete argument (apart from 'log aesthetics') for not letting it grow arbitrarily large?
NAK. This makes it harder to correlate different lines in the log across time.\n
